Articles.Content:
Hi, is there a good game out there that 

1: can run at 100 fps (specs in attachment)

2: No blood, or FPS

3: Optinal (but good) Freeware.

Thanks 

 8)
Why 100 fps? You can only see 24, and from 30 upwards, there is no effect at all.

We can see about 30, actually. 

I notice a difference between 25 fps games and 35, for sure. 

@ OP I see no attachment. Try again.
Well, from 7 upwards, I start ignoring the lagg. And since I cleanes my fan, I don\'t even experience lagg in KSP.
Ok heres my specs, and yeah maybe ill just need 30 fps.

Civilization II should be able to run pretty well.

No offense but that\'s a pretty meh system. 1GB of RAM with an integrated card, ~122mb dedicated... processor might be okay, dunno much about it.

Soldat should be good, it\'s a 2d side scrolling shooter with optional blood and a helluva lot more entertaining than it sounds.

Terraria might be able to be run on that, I am unaware of its requirements. 

N could probably run okay. Fun platformer/puzzle game. 

Ace of Spades *will* run, but it\'s a combo of Minecraft building and terraforming and an FPS, so that\'s up to you...

Age of Empires II should be fine to run. 

Empire Earth (original) should also be fine.

> 
> Civilization II should be able to run pretty well.
> 
> No offense but that\'s a pretty meh system. 1GB of RAM with an integrated card, ~122mb dedicated... processor might be okay, dunno much about it.
> 
> Soldat should be good, it\'s a 2d side scrolling shooter with optional blood and a helluva lot more entertaining than it sounds.
> 
> Terraria might be able to be run on that, I am unaware of its requirements. 
> 
> N could probably run okay. Fun platformer/puzzle game. 
> 
> Ace of Spades *will* run, but it\'s a combo of Minecraft building and terraforming and an FPS, so that\'s up to you...
> 
> Age of Empires II should be fine to run. 
> 
> Empire Earth (original) should also be fine.

I know, i remeber when this rig was high-tech when i bought it ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

i did do terraria (got bored) and ace of spades, and ive been looking at civilization II, might (just might) get it.
Why dont you try shogun? The first one.

> 
> Why dont you try shogun? The first one.

nah.

@Kreuzung: Eh, some of us can see the flicker on 75 Hz CRTs.

@sss

[Gratuitous Space Battles](http://positech.co.uk/gratuitousspacebattles/)

[Battle For Wesnoth](http://wesnoth.org/)

[Warning Forever](http://www.hikware.com/Prod/index.html#wf)

[Race Into Space](http://sourceforge.net/projects/raceintospace/) (Improved FLOSS version of BARIS)

[Endgame: Singularity](http://www.emhsoft.com/singularity/)

[Tyrian 2000](http://www.gog.com/en/gamecard/tyrian_2000/)

[Orbiter](http://orbit.medphys.ucl.ac.uk/) (Obviously)

[Slime Forest](http://lrnj.com/) Â¬.Â¬

[Lots of stuff by Zachtronics (SpaceChem, Bureau of Steam Engineering, Constructor...)](http://www.zachtronicsindustries.com/)

I would suggest Dwarf Fortress, but that tends to get blood everywhere.

Battle For Wesnoth is a superb tactical/strategy RPG/TBS. Too difficult for me after a few missions in each character\'s campaign, though... as soon as I lost a few veteran units, I couldn\'t win anything more.

thoose were the only good games i saw there LOL

Do you like RTS?

Could try out Warzone 2100, the developers gave it away, open source, when they went out of business to their modding community and it\'s been going (and improving) ever since. pretty old \'though.

(don\'t know if it would hit 100fps on your machine, it can on mine but drops below with lots of stuff going on on-screen)

[http://wz2100.net/](http://wz2100.net/)

Definitely SimEarth 

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SimEarth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SimEarth) 

Should be able to find it as abandonware.

> 
> Definitely SimEarth 
> 
> [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SimEarth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SimEarth)

ugh :![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) i can just say what i think in one word:

no.

SimCity 

Warlords 2

Sudden Strike 2

Alpha Centauri

Battlezone

Red Alert

Red Faction

The Elder Scrolls Part 1 : Arena

The Elder Scrolls Part II : Daggerfall

The Elder Scrolls III Morrowind

System Shock

System Shock 2

Anachronox

Deus Ex (original, stay away from Invisable War)

Theif Deadly Shadows

Darwinia

Multiwinia

DEFCON

Ultima (series)

Cannon Fodder (all old ones)

Choplifter

Prince of Persia (orignal and second)

All of these are garented to run (and be fun). Don\'t blame me for the graphics though, they are all old (except DEFCON, Multiwinia and Darwinia).
